IMO it was and is not a good idea to include the abcplus documentation PDF from http://abcplus.sourceforge.net/#ABCGuide in the abcm2ps package.

I think these are 2 different projects. I propose splitting it into 2 packages for example:

abcm2ps
abcplus

And keep these up-to-date independently from each other.
the ABCPLUS docs are not only about abcm2ps but also about tools from abcMIDI (unfortunately not in Fedora yet, but that's another story), and about abcpp and abc2prt (also not in Fedora yet). If ever abcMIDI is included in Fedora, abcplus would serve as additional documentation for both abcm2ps and abcMIDI.

And I would welcome a newer abcm2ps version in the Fedora repo. For now I'm using a self-compiled abcm2ps version 8.7.7, latest upstream stable version is 7.8.14! 5.9.21 is REALLY old and a lot has happened in the development of the ABC syntax the last few years that is only supported with an up-to-date abcm2ps version.

FEDORA-2020-eb7a965fcf has been submitted as an update to Fedora 30. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2020-eb7a965fcf
FEDORA-2020-7016bb7a0d has been submitted as an update to Fedora 31. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2020-7016bb7a0d

I am very happy abcm2ps finally has a new maintainer!

Two comments:

1) I think abcm2ps should be a project separate from the abcplus "Making Music with ABC PLUS" documentation. You have chosen to make it a subpackage, but it should be 2 really separate projects I think.

-abcm2ps (main author Jef Moine, http://moinejf.free.fr)
-abcplus-doc (main author Guido Gonzato, http://abcplus.sourceforge.net)

Guido Gonzato's document (there is a much newer version available on his website) is about ABC music syntax and the use of not only abcm2ps but also the tools from the abcMIDI package. That's why I think abcplus-doc, would be a better package name than abcm2ps-doc.

This brings me to my next comment:

2) The tools from abcMIDI, maintained upstream by Seymour Shlien should also be available as Fedora package. Latest version 2020.05.06 can be found at https://ifdo.ca/~seymour/runabc/top.html

I am running abcm2ps and the abcMIDI tools on Fedora 32. Compiled them myself from sources, but official Fedora packages would be nice.
But it's a good start that we now have a new abcm2ps Fedora package maintainer. Thanks!

bugs.title: CVE-2018-10753 abcm2ps: stack based buffer overflow in the delayed_output function in music.c [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-10753 abcm2ps: stack based buffer overflow in the delayed_output function in music.c [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2018-10753 abcm2ps: stack based buffer overflow in the delayed_output function in music.c

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in abcm2ps through 8.13.20. A stack based buffer overflow in the delayed_output function in music.c allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact.


References:
https://github.com/leesavide/abcm2ps/issues/16

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/leesavide/abcm2ps/commit/dc0372993674d0b50fedfbf7b9fad1239b8efc5f
